Module 4: Web Fundamentals ⏱ 25 min

How Does the Web Work?

Master the Fundamentals, Build with Confidence

Before you can build the web, you need to understand how it works. This isn’t about rote memorization; it’s about building a solid foundation so you can confidently navigate the digital landscape and speak the language of the web.

What You’ll Master

  • The Internet: What it is and how it moves data.
  • Packets: The building blocks of online communication.
  • Core Components: Web pages, servers, browsers, and search engines – demystified.
  • Clients & Servers: Understanding the fundamental interaction.
  • IP Addresses & DNS: How machines find each other.
  • Routers & ISPs: The infrastructure that makes it all possible.

Your Mission: Knowledge Check

Solidify your understanding by tackling these questions. If you’re unsure, dive back into the material. Remember, the goal is comprehension, not perfect recall.

  • What is a web server?
  • What is a network?
  • What is the internet?
  • What is an IP address?
  • What is a router?
  • What is an ISP?
  • What are packets and how are they used to transfer data?
  • What is a client?
  • What is a server?
  • What is a web page?
  • What is a web browser?
  • What is a search engine?
  • What is a DNS request?
  • Which browser are you currently using?
  • Describe, in your own words, the process of initiating a search on a search engine.
